adaptation_equation.definition: The equation to calculate the adaptation currrent.

adaptation_increment.definition: When an adaptation current is implemented the amount about which the adaptation is increased when a spike is fired.

adaptation_time_constant.definition: The time constant with which the adaptation current returns back to zero.

definition: Properties to describe a leaky integrate and fire neuron model.

noise_correlation.definition: The correlation time constant used e.g. with OU noise.

noise_type.definition: The type of noise. For example Gaussian, Ohrnstein-Uhlenbeck etc.

reset_potential.definition: The potential to which the neuron's potential is set after a spike.

threshold_equation.definition: The equation to calculate the threshold.

threshold_increment.definition: The voltage about which the threshold is increased once a spike has been fired.

threshold_time_constant.definition: The time ocnstant with which the threshold returns back to baseline.

timestep.definition: The duration of a time step in the simulation.

voltage_equation.definition: The equation to calculate the membrane voltage.
